column4: exciting, i booted from my ubuntu 9.04 USB stick and it blew out my vista partition
well the partition is still there, but it won't load
is there a gptsync for ubuntu 64?
is there a gptsync for ubuntu 64?
my system was running osx and vista 64 using the chameleon bootloader on an EFI partition...    i booted from a ubuntu USB drive and it deleted the boot loader
i got the chameleon bootloader reinstalled on the efi partition, but it won't load vista, something about the bootbcd
i'm here asking about this because its ubuntu that broke it
someone recommended i try gptsync, but i can't find it for ubuntu 64
so nobody has any input then?
for my issue
if no one answers please check out the forums
i won't finda nything on the forums about fixing my vista install that the usb disk broke, i searched
i am just offering solutions if no one here knows.
you have tried to recover the boot loader by checking out grub?
usb disk? wubi?
define do what ever it wanted.. what actually happens?

ell it failed to boot the usb stick, so i rebooted with it out and i just got a blinking cursor....  i used a boot132 CD to boot into osx and rebuild my EFI partition, and reinstall the chameleon bootloader.
eep.
